intro: Solenomelus chimboracensis, commonly known as the Chimborazo solenomelus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of Ecuador. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, often in humid, shaded areas of cloud forests. It has hairy leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
